ygData.subject: RE: FW: About the Bard running in the Rathe Mnts.
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh, What they need is a Cone of Silence spell.  Killing all emotes and says for the time it is in effect and cancellable at will. ... From: Daniel P.
ygData.messageBody:
Heh,

What they need is a "Cone of Silence" spell. Killing all emotes and says
for the time it is in effect and cancellable at will.

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel P. Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
Sent: Monday, February 28, 2000 11:11 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] FW: About the Bard running in the Rathe Mnts.


From: "Daniel P. Sniderman" <fuzzbone@...>

I attended the same thing with the same results in Xegony and I can't agree
more. Part of the problem were clueless "RP'ers" that thought that people
were interested in their stupid emotes "JoeBlow bows to Myomg Mistmore and
pledges his honor to him"

One thing that Verant could do that would probably be a trivial number of
lines of code - would be to change the text color of says from the GM's in
the event.

But the biggest problem is that the vast number of people who are just
unable to shut their traps!

Slyde
----- Original Message -----
From: "Sylly Songsynger" <jgs@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, February 28, 2000 8:54 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] FW: About the Bard running in the Rathe Mnts.


> From: "Sylly Songsynger" <jgs@...>
>
> We got wind of this GM event that was gonna happen in Mistmoore so we
headed
> on over. Sure enough, on the ramp near the zone was Lord Mistmoore (GM in
> PC looked like male DE), Lord Garamont (sp? a NPC), "a wounded elf" (NPC),
> and another NPC (if i recall correctly.) And they were trying to carry on
> some role playing dialog and unfold some story.
>
